data.title: System.ArgumentException: A null reference or invalid value was found [GDI+ status InvalidParameter]
data.body:
Under Fedora Linux (x86_64), OpenRA crashes at the multiplayer screen at the server browser after a few seconds. This does not happen with the same build under Windows 10.

Issue recreated on two separate systems.

Exception log contents as follows:

Red Alert Mod at Version release-20161019                                                           
on map e90c1d4ea07b7cbb048a1057a1b0be4f11ecbe90 (Desert Shellmap by Scott_NZ).                      
Date: 2017-02-22 22:23:30Z                                                                          
Operating System: Linux (Unix 4.8.13.100)                                                           
Runtime Version: Mono 4.2.1 (Stable 4.2.1.102/6dd2d0d Fri Jan  1 22:54:31 UTC 2016) CLR 4.0.30319.17020
Exception of type `System.ArgumentException`: A null reference or invalid value was found [GDI+ status: InvalidParameter]
  at System.Drawing.GDIPlus.CheckStatus (Status status) [0x0009b] in /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/mono-4.2.1/mcs/class/System.Drawing/System.Drawing/gdipFunctions.cs:212 
  at System.Drawing.Image.get_Width () [0x0000e] in /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/mono-4.2.1/mcs/class/System.Drawing/System.Drawing/Image.cs:766 
  at System.Drawing.Image.get_Size () [0x00000] in /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/mono-4.2.1/mcs/class/System.Drawing/System.Drawing/Image.cs:736 
  at (wrapper remoting-invoke-with-check) System.Drawing.Image:get_Size ()                          
  at OpenRA.Graphics.SheetBuilder.Add (System.Drawing.Bitmap src) <0x40f88380 + 0x0001f> in <filename unknown>:0

  at OpenRA.Primitives.ActionQueue.PerformActions (Int64 currentTime) <0x40cf38f0 + 0x001aa> in <filename unknown>:0 
  at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick () <0x40cf3790 + 0x0002f> in <filename unknown>:0                                                                                                                                   
  at OpenRA.Game.Loop () <0x40cf3510 + 0x00167> in <filename unknown>:0

data.title: [RA] [release-20161019] [Ubuntu] Not possible to play movies
data.body:
Hi,

I've extracted movies1.mix and movies2.mix and placed them under movies folder in the content folder.

When I try to play a video briefing (e.g. from 1st allied mission), it asks me to install via content management menu.

In this menu, I see something that the videos are not recocgnized (installable via CD).

Note : I've extracted the video files from French versions.

data.title: Utility and server: Get mod search paths from env MOD_SEARCH_PATHS
data.body:
This will allow thirdparty game developers to write and invoke custom *and shipped* utility commands.

The mod template will want this so it can wrap the utility in a shell script like the example below.

```sh
# utility.sh in the mod template
MODLAUNCHER=$(python -c "import os; print(os.path.realpath('$0'))")
MOD_ROOT=$(dirname "$MODLAUNCHER")
ENGINE_ROOT="$MOD_ROOT/engine"

MOD_SEARCH_PATHS="$ENGINE_ROOT/mods,$MOD_ROOT/mods" mono ./engine/OpenRA.Utility.exe "$@"
```

```sh
$ ./utility.sh
Run `OpenRA.Utility.exe [MOD]` to see a list of available commands.
The available mods are: all, cnc, d2k, modchooser, ra, ts, ra2

$ ./utility.sh ra2 | grep "import.*map"
  --import-ra-map FILENAME
  --import-td-map FILENAME
  --import-ts-map FILENAME
```

```sh
thill@tmba /Users/.../openra $ MOD_SEARCH_PATHS=. orautil
Run `OpenRA.Utility.exe [MOD]` to see a list of available commands.
The available mods are:

thill@tmba /Users/.../openra $ MOD_SEARCH_PATHS=./mods orautil
Run `OpenRA.Utility.exe [MOD]` to see a list of available commands.
The available mods are: all, cnc, d2k, modchooser, ra, ts

thill@tmba /Users/.../openra $ orautil
Run `OpenRA.Utility.exe [MOD]` to see a list of available commands.
The available mods are: all, cnc, d2k, modchooser, ra, ts

thill@tmba /Users/.../openra-ra2 $ MOD_SEARCH_PATHS=$(pwd)/mods,$(pwd)/engine/mods orautil
Run `OpenRA.Utility.exe [MOD]` to see a list of available commands.
The available mods are: ra2, all, cnc, d2k, modchooser, ra, ts

```

data.title: user configurable build palette order
data.body:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Traits/Buildable.cs#L49 so my suggestion would be to have a chrome (or settings yaml, but that requires #8276) entry where the sorting is defined.

The Half-Life mod Natural-Selection had bindable commander keys in a simple one dimensional array. We could do something similar for simplicity sake:
```
BuildPaletteOrder@Buildings: WEAP, PROC, HPAD...
BuildPaletteOrder@Vehicles: 1TNK, 2TNK, 3TNK...
```

data.title: Fix that Carryalls still pick units changed their owner
data.body: Fixes #12575.

data.title: [RA] [release-20161019] [Ubuntu] Not possible to use custom maps
data.body:
Hi,
I'm running latest version release-20161019 of OpenRA on Ubuntu 14.04.
I still have all my maps install under openra/maps/ra but they don't appear in the map selection (in Skirmish, ...).
I tried to move them under the new subfolder openra/maps/ra/release-20161019 but still I can see my maps in the map selection.
The maps are in oramap format and used to work in previous versions.
Did something change with customer maps in the latest version ?

data.title: Make an Option to Disable Surrendering
data.body:
Some LUA maps just crash or the Game is ruined if someone surrenders, it would be really nice if there is an option to just disable surrender.
If someone dont want to play further then he could just quit without crashing the game

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/21260178/23140994/d822a750-f7b4-11e6-9acb-497d9a628c8b.png)


The current look could cause confusion because (especially in third party mods) icons can be very similar.

data.title: Tiberium Dawn (Feature): add bookmark for options
data.body:
Maybe this feature has already been added to the game, but I was thinking it would be really convenient for the user to be able to save their settings on a multiplayer game or skirmish so that they don't have to reset the settings they prefer every time they decide to play a multiplayer game.

For example, going to the options on a multiplayer game, there would be a drop down menu called Saved settings, then you would see the last one you saved, which will be named by the user.

data.title: Fix that some buildings are incorrectly available in TD missions
data.body: Closes #12815.

data.title: Allied harvesters get stuck when trying to harvest the same tile
data.body:
I was playing a game last night with my brother, and we teamed up against computers. 

The maps we played were:
1. Morbid Aimless Poseidon
2. Escalations

To reproduce you basically have you and your allies harvesters gather tiberium in the same location. Eventually they will compete for the same tiberium, resulting in harvesters being stuck and never continuing their harvesting, which will cause you to never increase your cash amount, if you are not paying attention to your harvesters.

Maybe a potential fix would be to add some smarts to the harvester to recognize that something is in the way of its path, sort of like the minigunners that can avoid the tiberium, so that the harvester will move to a different tiberium tile instead of being stuck.

data.title: Some TD missions have buildable items that shouldn't be available
data.body:
At least GDI 3 lets you build Guard Towers and Sandbags (shouldn't be available) and at least shows Concrete Walls (which you cannot build because the prerequisite isn't available).

There may be more cases like this.

It should be possible to fix most or even all of these before the next release.

data.title: Veterancy calculation issue
data.body:
I was watching a recent replay and noticed a rifle that had only killed one engineer got double veterancy, the animation showed `+1 rank` but he instantly gained two chevrons

![ezgif com-resize](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1582784/23137840/47d364fe-f79c-11e6-917e-b1614100f66f.gif)

This happened in the attached replay at 2:01 in the bottom right corner.

[Click here to download replay](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/files/788279/2_for_the_price_of_1.orarep.tar.gz)

data.title: Artillery can't force fire onto camo pillboxes in the shroud.
data.body:
I'm not sure if this was a balancing thing or a bug, but what's the difference between firing on a blank tile in the shroud and firing on the tile where a camo pillbox has been placed. Nothing.. They are both just a location to provide to the unit to fire at. 

Having the camo pillbox show up in the shroud is fine, because once you learn of the location of one, you make a mental note to pay close attention to it with artillery or v2's, even if it disappears or something later. But restricting the ability to force fire on it is absolute garbage.

data.title: D2K - Add Harkonnen Mission 2a
Remove Hind from Allied build tree and give the Apache a chain gun as a secondary weapon
data.body:
I find it odd that the allies build Hinds, instead I propose that the hind be removed from the Allied build tree and instead bolster the armament of the Apache with it's M230 30mm chain gun. This weapon is great against infantry and lightly armed targets like jeeps, flack tracks and apcs. Then you can use the missiles for taking out heavily armed units like tanks, harvesters and buildings.  

For balance, they should not be able to engage air units with their Hellfire missiles as these are an air to ground missile. But the chain gun can be used to target other helicopters would not look out of place.  

This will of course require two bars for ammunition, which isn't such a bad thing.

On top of this, the hind could also be changed to account for it's Yak-B 12.7mm machine gun, and S-5 rocket pods.

data.title: Lua - Add a check for a tile is revealed by a player
data.body: There is such trigger in vanilla D2K and it is used in some missions. I used OnEnteredFootprint for now on 2 mission i made and uses that in original but i think correct solution is to add support for what original had.

data.title: Enable enemy reveal when attacking friendly units in D2k
data.body:
We have FoW enabled by default, which the original didn't have, this somewhat helps.
The original also had this (like all WW 2D RTS games).

This also fixes #7621.

I think we should try to squeeze this into the next playtest/release.

data.title: Integrity check the downloaded assets
data.body: Downloads might get corrupted during transfer or the asset mirror isn't distributing what it should. A hash could be stored in the yaml files to be checked against to verify the download is what it's supposed to be.

data.title: RA campaigns polish + unifying
data.body:
I feel that there are several issues with current missions, that are easy to change, but I think a disscussion is needed before undertaking them.

Now, there are several issues that are not easy to fix, especially general passivity compared to skirmish, because AI doesn't build/produce much on some maps, relying on reinforcements instead. Also other issues that are shared with general gameplay, like bogus dogs that make Soviet03 a gamble, or engies that change the balance on some missions where you have to capture stuff.

The issues I would like to adress/resolve now are:
- [ ] Original tech tree vs. tech tree equivalent to skirmishes, unifying the experience and making things less confusing to new players. This would also need some rebalancing and altering the gameplay. Would flak trucks be allowed for Soviets? What about rocket soldiers for soviet side?

- [ ] Undeploying the MCV is making things extremely easy for player, since the maps are usually made in such way that player has actively fight AI to gain control of new ore fields, while ATM he can basepush with small army group and cut off enemy, like in Soviet 05, where the central orefield is the only one for both AI and player.

- [ ] I heard something about colors being slighty different, and about changing them a bit. We should agree on one color scheme and follow it from now on.

Now for some specific issues:

- [ ] Pending feedback from players, I think the sub activity in Allied06 is a bit..extreme, bordering ridiculous. You can just build wall of turrets or rocketsoldiers to deal with enemy. Maybe have AI patrol in several areas, and put a limit on subs, around 20ish at once on whole map?

- [ ] Allied05, allowing Tanya to bomb half of enemy base including the only available ConYard is also a bit comical, but it was possible in original, too. Maybe release a pack of dogs/a tank on Tanya to make her retreat when she goes rampage on other things than SAMs?

Please, feel free to post about any other issue, balance or polish-wise you have with the campaign.

Pinging the main campaign contributors: @abcdefg30, @abc013, @Biofreak1987.

EDIT: Please note that also [forum ](http://www.sleipnirstuff.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=82&p=300330#300330)entry was opened.

data.title: Gather all official maps onto one account on the resource center.
data.body:
Some of the official RA maps have been deleted, I'm sure I did at some point, now displayed on http://www.openra.net/games/ as 'Unknown Map'.

This can be fixed by re-uploading the maps right now but for the future, all the official maps could be collected through just 1 account, or better, if possible an "official" account to witch maps per protocol are uploaded to shortly after merging PRs. Right now the maps are hosted through  @ihptru , @reaperrr , myself and others, who knows. This also prevents users from cleaning out their own content in fear of deleting official maps. I would certainly love to do that at some point.

This would also make altering official maps much easier as done with #12798 which has a lot of new maps slightly altered from custom maps in order to fit certain standards.

data.title: Remove deprecated Lua APIs / upgrade rules
data.body: Some final house-keeping to prepare for a new playtest cycle.

data.title: Mobile S.A.M missiles are comically large.
data.body: The `patriot` projectile image is about twice the size as the missiles on the back of the launcher, and are possibly longer than the launcher itself.  The `MISSILE` image used by the stationary S.A.M site looks much better.

data.title: Infantry disappear when a player is defeated/surrenders/leaves game.
data.body: This is a bug for TS, where it played Die1 instead. These cases should have an option to apply the killing via using damagetypes.

data.title: Add shadows to TD projectiles and fix Napalm bombs
data.body:
Closes #12799.
Fixes #12800.
